reasons_to_visit.details: February offers low season benefits: significantly fewer crowds at landmarks like the White Tower, Rotunda, Ano Poli, and museums, plus lower prices for accommodation and flights.
While still winter, Thessaloniki can have crisp, sunny days (average highs 10-12°C) suitable for comfortable walking along the waterfront or exploring historic sites without intense heat or crowds.

Depending on the Orthodox calendar, Carnival ('Apokries') often falls in February. Tsiknopempti (Smoky Thursday) sees widespread meat grilling in tavernas, especially in areas like Ladadika or Ano Poli. Check for local parades or events.
Late February might bring the first hints of spring, possibly with some early blossoms in parks or clearer days along the Thermaic Gulf.
Perfect weather for dedicating time to Thessaloniki's excellent museums (Archaeological, Byzantine Culture, MOMus network, Jewish Museum) without feeling rushed.
With fewer tourists, experience a more authentic slice of Thessaloniki life in cafes, the Kapani/Modiano markets, and neighborhoods beyond the main center.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: February remains cold (lows 3-5°C). Expect potential for rain, dampness, chilly winds ('Vardaris'), and occasional fog from the gulf. Pack warm and waterproof clothing.
Days are still relatively short (sunset around 6:30 PM by month end), limiting daylight for outdoor exploration, although museums usually have good hours.
While major sites are open, some seasonal businesses (especially island-focused tours or specific restaurants) might still operate on reduced winter schedules.
Ensure your accommodation has effective and reliable heating, as evenings and nights are cold and can feel damp.
As with other times, strikes affecting public transport or sites can occur, sometimes with limited notice.
The bustling outdoor cafe scene along the waterfront is much quieter than in warmer months, with activity moving indoors or to cafes with heaters.

weather.precipitation: Moderate to high chance of rain (average ~40-50mm for month). Mix of overcast/rainy/foggy days and cool, possibly sunny spells.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers (including sweaters/fleece), a waterproof jacket, comfortable walking shoes (water-resistant useful), scarf, gloves. Umbrella is recommended.

tourism_level.crowds: Very low. Ideal time for visiting museums and landmarks without queues.
tourism_level.pricing: Typically the lowest of the year for flights and accommodation.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Quiet and local. Good for focused sightseeing, enjoying cozy cafes, and museum hopping.

events_holidays.name: Possible start of Apokries (Carnival)
events_holidays.description: If the Carnival period begins early, you might see initial decorations or small-scale events. The main events are usually later.
events_holidays.notes: Check the Orthodox Easter calendar for specific Apokries dates for the year.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the city's symbol with minimal queues and enjoy a brisk walk along the extensive waterfront promenade on a clear day.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check White Tower winter hours. Dress warmly for the waterfront walk. Museum inside tower is small.

unique_experiences.description: Spend hours exploring the rich history of Macedonia and Thessaloniki without feeling rushed. Excellent choice for a cold or rainy day.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allocate 2-3 hours. Combined tickets with Byzantine Museum often available.

unique_experiences.description: Wander through the atmospheric, colourful streets of Ladadika. Quieter during winter days, comes alive with tavernas and bars in the evening.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Good area for dinner or drinks in the evening. Many places have indoor seating.

unique_experiences.activity: Warm Up in a Local Cafe or Tsipouradiko
unique_experiences.where: Various neighborhoods (City center, Ano Poli, Kalamaria)
unique_experiences.description: Escape the chill in a traditional kafeneio, a modern cafe, or a 'tsipouradiko' (serving tsipouro spirit with meze). Observe local life and enjoy the cozy atmosphere.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Often simple, traditional settings. Good for a short break.

weather.precipitation: Rain possibility continues, but chances for sunny spells might increase slightly. Hints of spring, like early blossoms, might appear.
weather.general_tips: Continue with layered clothing and waterproof gear. Daylight hours increase slightly.

tourism_level.crowds: Still generally low, but increases significantly if main Carnival events (parades, Tsiknopempti) fall during this period.
tourism_level.pricing: Remains low unless coinciding with peak Carnival dates, where some price increase is possible.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Can transition from quiet to quite lively and festive if Carnival celebrations are underway. Otherwise, remains calm.

events_holidays.name: Tsiknopempti ('Smoky Thursday')
events_holidays.date: Varies (usually 11 days before Clean Monday - often late Feb)
events_holidays.description: Part of Apokries. Characterized by extensive grilling of meat. Expect smoke and lively atmosphere in tavernas, especially in Ladadika, Ano Poli, or city center eateries.
events_holidays.notes: Tavernas will be very busy; book if planning to eat out. Fun, festive atmosphere.

events_holidays.name: Apokries Parades/Events
events_holidays.date: Varies (peak usually the last weekend before Clean Monday - often late Feb/early Mar)
events_holidays.description: Check for local Carnival parades (might be smaller scale than Athens or Patras), costume parties, or events in specific neighborhoods or suburbs of Thessaloniki.
events_holidays.notes: Can be crowded and lively. Public transport might be affected near parade routes.

unique_experiences.where: Tavernas in Ladadika, Ano Poli, city center
unique_experiences.description: Join the festive mood as Thessalonians grill and feast on meat. Find a taverna (book ahead!) or walk around lively areas absorbing the sounds and smells.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Vegetarians might find options limited this specific day! Expect a lively, smoky environment.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Museum of Byzantine Culture
unique_experiences.description: Explore the impressive collection showcasing Byzantine art and culture from the region, enjoying the exhibits without summer crowds.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allocate 2-3 hours. Cafe on site. Check for temporary exhibitions.

unique_experiences.activity: Walk in Ano Poli (Upper Town) (Weather Permitting)
unique_experiences.where: Historic neighborhood north of city center
unique_experiences.description: On a clear day, climb up to the Kastra (walls) for panoramic city and sea views. Explore the traditional architecture and Byzantine churches.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear sturdy shoes for steep, winding streets. Can be cold/windy. Offers great photo opportunities.

unique_experiences.where: Central Market Area, off Egnatia Street
unique_experiences.description: Immerse yourself in the lively, traditional covered markets (Kapani is more food, Modiano has tavernas too). Experience the local shopping buzz.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Busiest in the morning (Mon-Sat). Good place for photos and finding local products. Modiano Market recently renovated.
